definition[0]: if a problem, difficulty etc confronts you, it appears and needs to be dealt with
example[0]: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
example[1]: Customers are confronted with a bewildering amount of choice.
definition[1]: to deal with something very difficult or unpleasant in a brave and determined way
example[2]: We try to help people confront their problems.
definition[2]: to face someone in a threatening way, as though you are going to attack them
example[3]: Troops were confronted by an angry mob.
definition[3]: to accuse someone of doing something, especially by showing them the proof
example[4]: I confronted him with my suspicions, and he admitted everything.
